body.p:
Louisville March 30. 1864
To his Excellency the Governor
Governor --

Enclosed you will find a petition which explains itself -- I know the statements in the petition are true, and it seems to me the case presents more than ordinary claims upon executive clemency. You will perseeve among the names of those who recommend it, are those of Judge Johnson before whom the boy was tried and Priest the chief of the city police -- The other names are all persons to you -- I could have swelled the list out indefinitely but did not think it would add anything to the strength of her claims

Jefferson Cir Ct
vs
Jos Smythe
